adviseScripts.text: I feel as if my luck has taken an unfortunate turn of late.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: My machines are abandoning me quicker than ever.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Can nothing be done about this?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Let Alice do all the work for you.
Let me do the work for you.
She has already done enough service in my name.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I dare not impose upon her anymore.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You? With your own two hands?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: This suggestion pleases me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Yet, are you not already sufficiently burdened with responsibilities?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Worry not. I will face these troubles on my own.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Ludmilla about how she destroys everything she touches.
I have been thinking.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: This world is a cruel place. It is my wish that Alice will quickly come of age, so that she can get by on her own.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, I fear that she may lose her innocence in the process.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Then again, as her guardian, perhaps I am just being selfish.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Even if she has to grow up, Alice will always be Alice.
It's fine. All parents are like that.
Do you truly think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Even when they come of age, people don't really change.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hearing that puts me at ease. I thank you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Somehow, I thought that I would be different.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I shouldn't worry so much. This all will pass in time, like everything else.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Ludmilla while thinking about Alice.
Every time you come here, you appear to be on the verge of becoming a popsicle.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Is there anything I could do to make you more comfortable?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Any chance you have a space heater?
Any chance I could get a hug from you?
A space heater? I assume it's a machine of some sort.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Very well. I shall procure one forthwith.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, I doubt its warmth could withstand my cold for long.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: A-ha!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: So, it is my embrace that you desire?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Very well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Come to me any time you are cold, and I will have a warm embrace waiting for you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Ludmilla about how to withstand the frigid Northern temperatures.
Hm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: This tea tastes nothing like it used to.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I prepared it in the usual way, and used the usual ingredients...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Perhaps my taste buds are beginning to age?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Maybe it's the tea leaves that got old.
... Good luck with that.
Now that I look at them, I believe you may be right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It's been a while since I bought these tea leaves.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Thanks to you, I have found the solution.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You rogue! You actually took my comment seriously?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I don't need your empty encouragement. I'm not that old yet!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I spend time having tea with Ludmilla.
If I recall, you said that Liter is in your Outpost?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I want to give her a present to celebrate the beginning of her new job there.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What should I get for her?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: A doggie bone made of ice?
A hand-written letter?
What an innovative idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Volt will love that, too!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Marvelous suggestion. That's just what I'll get her.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Don't you think that's a bit... plain?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I want to do something truly special...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hm. I require more time to think.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Ludmilla about Liter.
Servant, several of the Nikkes were wondering...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Do you have a type?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Someone who carries themselves like a Queen.
Are you sure it's not just you that's curious, Ludmilla?
Ha! I can see that you are teasing me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm not so dense that I can't pick up on your not-so-subtle intimations.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, if you happen to be speaking the truth, know that I wouldn't mind.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Why in the world would I be so curious about such a trivial thing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Why would I bother to spare a thought for your type?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: After all...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You are nothing but my Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Ludmilla about my type.
Royal Road.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Alice told me she heard about Royal Road today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It's been so long since I've heard someone mention that place. I do miss it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Speaking of, have you ever been to Royal Road?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have.
I haven't.
Ha. I should have known.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It is not unreasonable for you to have been there before.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It is a pity, though. If you hadn't been there before, I could have made an excuse to take you there myself.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Oh? You've never been?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: In that case, why don't I take you there?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm a bit of a big deal in that area, so I'll have to wear a disguise.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Ludmilla about Royal Road.
Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: How would you define family?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Similar to the relationship between you and Alice.
It's a relationship between those who are related by blood.
Alice and I...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: we may not share the same blood,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but I believe that we are connected on a deep level.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Thank you for sharing your opinion with me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Yes, that is the normal definition of family.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, I think there's more to it than that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Blood shouldn't be the only thing that defines a family. The heart also plays a role.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: At least, that's how I feel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I continue to ponder about family.
Andersen has something of a soft spot for you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Did you already know this?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'd rather have the affection of someone else.
No, and I don't want to know.
A-ha! Well, I know he is not your type.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, his affection does offer you more material benefits, right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: So long as you don't despise him for feeling that way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Oh, my. You hate it to the point that you don't want to even know about it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I had no idea you despised Andersen with such fervor!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Ludmilla talking about Andersen.
A few days ago, after I rescued a Nikke, she asked me:
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: How can you live in such an unforgiving place?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What about you? Do you think living here is difficult?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It is a very inhospitable place.
It has its own stark beauty.
Do you truly think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I suppose I can sympathize.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It is indeed not particularly suited for human habitation.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Precisely!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I could not agree more.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It is a perilous place, with danger around every corner.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: But therein lies its beauty! Or so I believe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I spend some meaningful time with Ludmilla.
You must have been to the Outer Rim, yes?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What do you think of it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It's a cesspool of crime and corruption.
It's far from heaven, that much is certain.
I didn't expect you to feel that way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I thought you would view it in a different light.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'll take note of that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You and I are in agreement there.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It's a society formed by splinter groups of those who have been abandoned.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: That's why it's such a dangerous and isolated place.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I speak more about the Outer Rim.
Hmmm... I want to try a new tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What should I try?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Some bitter tea.
Some aromatic tea.
You think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: That's actually what I was leaning towards anyway.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Very well then, prepare the tea Servant!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I think I'm more in the mood for bitter tea today...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but what the heck, I'll go for some aromatic tea instead.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hurry and prepare the tea, Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I sip tea together while discussing the various types of tea.
What splendid weather we're having.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What do you usually do on days like today?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I like staying inside all day.
It'd be nice to go out and have some tea.
You're going to stay cooped up inside when the weather is this nice?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Absolutely not. Get up.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Let's go outside and have some tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You are an amazing servant indeed!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You're capable of reading the mind of whom you serve.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Now then, let us go.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I go out on a picnic with Ludmilla.
When you look at snow, what does it make you think of?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You.
Traumatic past events.
Good answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If I'm the first thing you think over every time you lay eyes upon the North, or the snow,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I will be very glad indeed.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Understandable.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Especially with how you nearly perished while buried under the snow.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I talk more about snow.
Safety amidst lies
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: and danger amidst reality...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Which would you choose?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Safety amidst lies.
Danger amidst reality.
It's no surprise someone from the Ark would think so.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: For a person who knows the surface well, I thought you would have a different response.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm not sure if you really think so.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: But it would be better for you to remember that
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: falsehood always invites greater danger.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I knew you would think so as you know the surface well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: That's why you are probably getting lost all the time.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: But do not worry.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: The closer you are to the truth, the more dangerous it gets. Yet, because of this risk you shoulder,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: the Nikkes are willing to lay their lives to protect you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I spend some meaningful time with Ludmilla.
Did you know?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: There aren't many Commander who take the time to consult with their Nikkes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Why are you going to so much trouble to listen to all of our concerns?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You're all my friends and squadmates. I want to know what's on your mind.
I wonder what makes Nikkes tick.
Good answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Very good answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I hope it's not just for the show.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: When you put it that way,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: it sounds like you're just going through the motions of what needs doing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I suppose I can understand that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I talk more about why I'm so intent on listening to my Nikkes.
Ludmilla is staring intently at her phone.
I forgot to bring my gloves...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: *Zzzhh* *Zhhh*
Hurl the phone far away from Ludmilla before it breaks.
Snatch the phone and ask what she is trying to do.
*Crash*
You made a wise decision. However...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: ... the phone is now destroyed.
I think you may have gotten a little carried away.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Can you use your phone to let Alice know we're in the middle of a discussion?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Well done, Servant!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Send Alice a message and let her know we're in the middle of a discussion.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I helped Ludmilla send Alice a message.
Given my condition, do you think it would be better if I
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: called people, or sent them messages?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Calling.
Messaging.
Oh? How so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If you use a speakerphone, you don't have to hold the phone for very long.
I thought you were going to say because you liked hearing my voice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, you've put forth a very convincing argument just now!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hmm? How so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: When you text someone, the conversation goes on longer than when you talk on the phone.
I understand what you're saying, but I'm not sure what type of phone is out there that could
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: handle me holding it for that long...Either way, I'll keep that in mind.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about using phones for extended periods of time.
I know that you've been to many different places up on the surface.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Looking back, are there any locations that stand out?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: For one, I remember the snowfields up north, where I met you.
Nothing much comes to mind.
I'm delighted to hear you feel that way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I too have a special attachment to the place where we first met.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: ... Understandable. The surface is such a danger zone, I'm sure everything starts to blend together.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I hope one day you'll have been to some areas you feel are worth remembering.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: When that happens, the surface will no longer seem so threatening to you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I go through all the previous places I'd been to on the surface with Ludmilla.
Andersen sent a new tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla hands over a teacup.
Would you like to try it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Not if it's from him.
Sure, why not.
Are you sure?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm sorry you feel that way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I was looking forward to drinking it together.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Well, what do you think?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It must feel nice for your lips to be touching the cup where my lips have just been.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, this is too fun!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I have a nice time together having tea.
